section.title: Download RSGallery2 package
section.para: On RSGallery2's homepage, www.rsgallery2.nl, there is a link to the latest release of RSGallery2. Each release shows a version number and on which version of Joomla! it can be used.

Older versions are available on JoomlaCode where you'll see the available releases when you click the Package "RSGallery2". The release name will be something like RSGallery2_2.1.1_J15 which tells you it is version 2.1.1 and intended for Joomla! 1.5 whereas RSGallery2_3.0.1_J16J17 is version 3.0.1 and intended for Joomla! 1.6 and 1.7.

section.title: Installing RSGallery2
section.para: RSGallery2 is installed as any other Joomla! extension. First you have to log in to the Administrator section, also called Backend. Click on Extensions > Extension Manager (see ). Then click the Browse button and find and select the downloaded package file. Back on the Extension Manager page you'll see that the path to your selected package file is shown in Package File. Now click Upload & Install.

figure.title: Backend Extension Manager showing the drop-down menu for Extensions.

section.para: Joomla! will tell you when the component is installed successfully ().
You will see a number of messages, green checkmarks indicate what went well. Below that, there is a button that'll take you to RSGallery2's Control Panel.

figure.title: After successful fresh installation: Control Panel button.

section.title: Updating RSGallery2
section.para: Updating RSGallery2 to the latest version is no different than installing RSGallery2 for the first time. Either visit RSGallery2's homepage, www.rsgallery2.nl, or the download section on JoomlaCode to find out what the latest version is. If there is a new release, for the Joomla! version you are using, download it and install as indicated in .

important.para: Always keep a recent backup of your site! See http://docs.joomla.org/Backup.

section.para: Upon successfull update of RSGallery2 you will see some messages, e.g. telling you what version you updated from and what version you updated to (see ). If there is something you should know it will be posted with these messages.

figure.title: Update of RSGallery2 from 3.0.2 to 3.1.0 was successfull.

section.title: First steps after installation
section.para: After you have installed you will want to make one or more galleries first. See on how to create a gallery. Then you can upload one or more images. See on how to upload a single image and on how to upload a batch of images. Then you will have to create a menu item linking to RSGallery2 for your frontend users to see your gallery/galleries with your uploaded images. See on how to create a menu item linking to your gallery/galleries. This will get you going and start learning how RSGallery2 works.
After you have done this you will probably see some things you want to adapt to your wishes. See about the RSGallery2 Configuration options.
